titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Long Island bills and receipts collection 1977.295
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:47 +0000.

did.unittitle: Long Island bills and receipts collection
did.abstract: The Long Island bills and receipts collection spans the period 1794 to 1886 and consists of twenty-nine bills and receipts from various places on Long Island (including Queens County) for textiles, dry goods, household goods, and horse and smithy goods and services.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Peter L. Van Santvoord, 1966.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Island bills and receipts collection, 1977.295, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
